title: Exercise 1. [First bl...string]
description:
Write a program that prints out the string "Hello world" where this string is stored in a variable of your program.

Example: The output of your program will be "Hello world".

title: Exercise 2. [Greetings]
description:
Alice and Bob has their little habit when they chat on their favorite messaging app.
Alice always starts a conversation with a "he..ey" (It's the string "hey" with one or more 'e' characters following) and Bob always answers with a "he..ey" where the number of 'e' characters is twice the number of 'e' characters in Alice's "he..ey".
Write a program that takes as input a string s of size 3 <= n <= 100 containing Alice's "he..ey" (we assume that the string always starts with a single 'h' followed by one or more 'e' and always ends with a single 'y'; then the program will display Bob's response).

Example: For the input "heeeey", the output should be "heeeeeeeey".
